articles.headline: Chasing Amazon, Retailers Are in a Never-Ending Arms Race
articles.snippet: The economy is relatively strong, and consumers are spending. So why are things so tough for some retailers?
articles.abstract: The economy is relatively strong, and consumers are spending. So why are things so tough for some retailers?
articles.lead_paragraph: Retailers are trying everything they can to keep up with Amazon. Macy’s offers same-day delivery and in-store returns for online purchases. Black Friday deals are already starting at Kohl’s. And craft cocktails are served in the women’s shoe department at Nordstrom.
articles.byline: By Sapna Maheshwari and Michael Corkery

articles.headline: Donald McGahn Must Testify to Congress, Judge Rules; Administration Will Appeal
articles.snippet: A judge rejected the Trump administration’s argument that senior White House officials were immune from congressional subpoenas.
articles.abstract: A judge rejected the Trump administration’s argument that senior White House officials were immune from congressional subpoenas.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The former White House counsel Donald F. McGahn II must testify before House impeachment investigators about President Trump’s efforts to obstruct the Mueller inquiry, a judge ruled on Monday, saying that senior presidential aides must comply with congressional subpoenas and calling the administration’s arguments to the contrary “fiction.”

articles.headline: Activists Build a Grass-Roots Alliance Against Amazon
articles.snippet: As groups join a coalition against the internet giant, a new report underlines its troubling impact in warehouse towns.
articles.abstract: As groups join a coalition against the internet giant, a new report underlines its troubling impact in warehouse towns.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Amazon flourished over its first two decades with little opposition and less scrutiny. A new coalition and a report unveiled on Tuesday make clear that era is over.

articles.headline: When Mom Slams a Brand on Instagram
articles.snippet: Mom influencers hold great sway over their loyal audiences. So how much research should they do before criticizing a company?
articles.abstract: Mom influencers hold great sway over their loyal audiences. So how much research should they do before criticizing a company?
articles.lead_paragraph: As a mom with influence, Caitlin Houston felt the need to act.

articles.headline: Meet the Leftish Economist With a New Story About Capitalism
articles.snippet: Mariana Mazzucato wants liberals to talk less about the redistribution of wealth and more about its creation. Politicians around the world are listening.
articles.abstract: Mariana Mazzucato wants liberals to talk less about the redistribution of wealth and more about its creation. Politicians around the world are listening.
articles.lead_paragraph: Mariana Mazzucato was freezing. Outside, it was a humid late-September day in Manhattan, but inside — in a Columbia University conference space full of scientists, academics and businesspeople advising the United Nations on sustainability — the air conditioning was on full blast.

articles.headline: Thomas Barrack, a Trump Confidant, Is Targeted by an Investor
articles.snippet: Blackwells Capital has started a campaign to pressure Mr. Barrack, the chairman of President Trump’s inaugural committee, to resign from Colony Capital.
articles.abstract: Blackwells Capital has started a campaign to pressure Mr. Barrack, the chairman of President Trump’s inaugural committee, to resign from Colony Capital.
articles.lead_paragraph: Thomas J. Barrack Jr., the chairman of President Trump’s inaugural committee, is under pressure from an activist investor to resign as chief executive of Colony Capital, a real estate investment firm he founded.
articles.byline: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Gregory Schmidt
